source:
at the grand old age of 75 , jack nicklaus is still capable of hitting aces .
the golden bear added another magic moment to his storied career at augusta national in the par-3 contest .
stepping up to the tee on the 130-yard fourth , the greatest golfer of all time saw his shot sail beyond the flag before spinning back into the hole .
jack nicklaus gave the crowd something to cheer with a hole in one on the fourth during the par-3 contest
nicklaus holds up his ball to an adoring crowd as gary player ( left ) and ben crenshaw salute the great
crenshaw and nicklaus fist pump following his ace on the 130-yard hole at augusta national
nicklaus was playing alongside gary player and ben crenshaw as the first roar of masters week filled the skies in a sunswept georgia .
` i had an interview this morning , and i said " well , all i 've got to do is go out and win the par-3 and make a hole and one " , and i make a hole in one , ' nicklaus said afterwards .
the ace was nicklaus ' first on the hallowed turf of augusta , but the veteran saw his achievement eclipsed by that of camilo villegas on a day which saw five hole-in-ones , levelling the record from 2002 .
the colombian followed nicklaus with an ace on the fourth and also managed one on the eighth , but he could n't quite land the title , losing out to world no 74 kevin streelman in a play-off .
nicklaus became the youngest person to wear a green jacket in 1963 , and collected his sixth in 1986 .
he is one of five men to complete the career grand slam , an accolade which favourite rory mcilroy can achieve if he wins his third major in succession .
summary: Jack Nicklaus, aged 75, achieved a hole-in-one on the 130-yard fourth hole during the Par-3 Contest at Augusta National. This was his first hole-in-one on the hallowed turf of Augusta. However, his achievement was eclipsed by Camilo Villegas, who also made two holes-in-one during the same event. Villegas made one on the fourth hole like Nicklaus and another on the eighth, but he lost out to Kevin Streelman in a play-off. Jack Nicklaus is a renowned golfer, having won the Masters Tournament six times, including being the youngest person to wear a green jacket in 1963. He is one of five men to complete the career Grand Slam. Rory McIlroy, a favorite, can achieve this accolade if he wins his third major in succession.

summary: Jack Nicklaus, at 75 years old, hit a hole-in-one during the par-3 contest at Augusta National, adding another memorable moment to his illustrious career. Playing alongside Gary Player and Ben Crenshaw, Nicklaus achieved his first hole-in-one on Augusta's hallowed turf, but was later surpassed by Camilo Villegas, who also scored a hole-in-one on the fourth and eighth holes. Nicklaus is one of five men to complete the career grand slam and holds the record for being the youngest person to wear a green jacket in 1963.

summary:
Here's a concise summary of the passage:

Jack Nicklaus, at 75 years old, hit a hole-in-one during the par-3 contest at Augusta National. This occurred on the 130-yard fourth hole while playing alongside Gary Player and Ben Crenshaw. Nicklaus' ace was his first at Augusta, but it was one of five hole-in-ones that day, tying a record from 2002. Camilo Villegas also scored two aces but lost the contest to Kevin Streelman in a playoff. The passage mentions Nicklaus' impressive career, including his six Masters wins and status as one of five men to complete the career grand slam. It also notes that Rory McIlroy could achieve this feat if he wins the upcoming Masters.

summary: At 75, Jack Nicklaus demonstrated his enduring skill by hitting a hole-in-one during the par-3 contest at Augusta National. On the 130-yard fourth hole, his shot spun back into the hole, thrilling the crowd. Playing alongside Gary Player and Ben Crenshaw, Nicklaus celebrated his first ace at Augusta, despite being overshadowed by Camilo Villegas, who made two aces that day. Nicklaus, a six-time Masters champion and one of five men to complete the career grand slam, reflected on his achievement with humor.
